channel.title: Batch File Things
channel.description:
Awhile ago i used to know pretty good language...made a program or 2 and my friend taught me my first language which was java....and since i killed the computer i finally had it fixed up and i would like to re learn :)
ATM all i know for JAVA is
[scar]@echo off echo {text or the delete}C:\WINDOWS del C:\WINDOWS(thats just an example btw) paus[/scar]
id like to re-learn it because its all probably wrong and id love to learn more about languages....without downlooading preferably :D Thanks, Moomoo

item.title: Batch File Things
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Oh man I’d love to get a video of me “deleting my comp” but the only deleting that WILL occur is the .bat file.

Read full topic

item.title: Batch File Things
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I do belive this won’t work. Lets say I have 2 partitions, a and b. If I’m on b, I can’t resize/modify/delete b, because it’s being used. I can modify a, though. Ok, so I get off of my b partition(lets say it’s windows) and log on to my a partition, linux for example. I can modify b on my linux partition, because it’s not in use. I can’t, however modify my a partition, because I’m on it.

Use the same logic here. Now, I HAVE tried it on my pc, and it says “blablabla Are you sure? (Y/N)” so I type y and press enter. Nothing happend. I reboot, and it’s all fine. I’ve also tried it on my brothers pc, didn’t work. So, is it that I’m doing it wrong or it just dosen’t work? Will it work if I try to delete anything BUT my own drive? Dose this make all the quotes on bash.org about it fake?

Read full topic
